short_summary: National Master Standing Offer (NMSO) for the supply of commercial tires.
description: Establish a National Master Standing Offer for commercial tires for all Federal Government Departments and Provincial/Territorial Identified Users across Canada for the procurement of commercial tires and airless tires with a one-year period from 2024-04-01 to 2025-03-31. Annual estimated usage is 35,000 commercial tires.
full_summary:
**Procurement Announcement: National Master Standing Offer - Commercial Tires** 

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is seeking proposals for a National Master Standing Offer (NMSO) to provide commercial tires for various vehicle categories through a four-year contract. 

**Tender Details**

* Tender Reference: WS4330611116-GS-000000
* Tender Notice Publication Date: February 13, 2024
* Tender Closing Date: March 14, 2024, 14:00 EST
* Anticipated Contract Start Date: April 1, 2024
* Anticipated Contract End Date: March 31, 2025
* Contract Duration: Five years, with option to extend up to 12 months

**Scope of Work**

The NMSO will provide commercial tires, including but not limited to, passenger, light truck, medium truck tires, and airless tires, for various government departments and Provincial/Territorial Identified Users across Canada. The NMSO will also provide tire tubes and maintenance labor to meet customer requirements.

**Estimated Volume and Timeline**

The estimated annual usage is 35,000 commercial tires, with an expected requirement to supply 140,000 tires throughout the contract term.

**Trade Agreements**

The NMSO is pursuant to the Government of Canada's domestic trade agreements, including but not limited to, the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA).

**Regions of Opportunity**

The NMSO is open to all qualified contractors across Canada, with delivery locations in the following provinces/territories:

* Alberta
* British Columbia
* Manitoba
* New Brunswick
* Newfoundland and Labrador
* Nova Scotia
* Ontario
* Prince Edward Island
* Quebec
* Saskatchewan

**How to Get Involved**

Interested contractors can access the RFP and related documentation on Ariba Discovery. To participate, go to: https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18782515?extsite...

**Contact Information**

For questions or inquiries, please do not hesitate to contact Baderlama Salouane at baderllama.salouane@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca, quoting the RFP reference number WS4330611116-001.

Please note that all submitted responses must be received by March 14, 2024, at 14:00 EST to be considered for evaluation. The contract award is anticipated to occur in spring 2024.
